states.name: No Analysis
symptoms: Jumping straight to searching without analyzing the topic
states.test: Can you articulate stakeholders, temporal scope, and domain mapping?
states.intervention: Run Phase 0 Analysis Template before generating queries

states.name: No Vocabulary Map
states.test: Have you identified expert vs. outsider terms? Terms across domains?
states.intervention: Build vocabulary map. Hunt for 'also known as,' 'technically called' in early sources.

states.name: Single-Perspective Search
states.test: Have you explicitly searched for opposing perspectives?
states.intervention: Generate competing perspectives queries. Search for strongest counterargument.

states.name: Domain Blindness
states.test: Have you mapped terminology variants across fields?
states.intervention: Identify what adjacent fields call this topic. Search in at least 2 domains.

states.name: Recency Bias
states.test: Can you explain when this topic emerged and how it evolved?
states.intervention: Add historical context queries. Find seminal works.

states.name: Breadth Without Depth
states.test: Can you define key terms in your own words?
states.intervention: Apply 3-source rule per perspective. Summarize before searching more.

states.name: Completion Uncertainty
symptoms: Unsure whether to continue or stop
states.test: Can you answer the tiered completion criteria?
states.intervention: Run completion checklist. Look for diminishing returns signals.

states.name: Research Complete
symptoms: Can explain topic, identify uncertainties, and take action

states.name: No Persistence
states.test: Did you check for prior research before starting? Are you storing findings?
states.intervention: Store vocabulary map, sources, digested notes, and gaps for future use.

states.name: Scope Mismatch
states.test: Is research depth proportional to decision stakes?
states.intervention: Apply scope calibration. Match confidence level to decision reversibility and stakes.

states.name: No Confidence Signaling
symptoms: Reader can't tell what's certain vs. speculative
states.test: Can reader distinguish established facts from speculation?
states.intervention: Use explicit confidence markers. State source quality and consensus status.

vocabulary.context: Structured analysis of topic before searching: concepts, stakeholders, temporal scope, domains, controversies
Primary research deliverable mapping expert vs. outsider terms, cross-domain synonyms, depth indicators
Essential vocabulary requiring precise definition within the research domain
Introductory, working, expert - levels of terminology that surface different content
Signals that research is complete: circular references, repetitive findings, marginal additions
Research completed without follow-up questions - agent-executed, time-boxed queries
Matching research depth to decision stakes: reversibility, consequences, time available
Explicit phrases signaling certainty level: established fact, strong evidence, limited evidence, unknown
Mapping primary actors, affected groups, opposing interests
Identifying primary and adjacent fields that study this topic
Foundational, historical, current, competing, evidence - different search approaches
Minimum viable, working knowledge, deep expertise - tiered research stopping points

processes.name: Topic Analysis
processes.description: Analyze topic through multiple lenses before searching: core concepts, stakeholders, temporal context, domains, controversies

processes.name: Vocabulary Mapping
processes.description: Build vocabulary map as primary deliverable: core terms, synonyms, depth indicators

processes.name: Query Construction
processes.description: Generate specific search queries: foundational, historical, current, competing, evidence

integrations.description: Store research findings in appropriate network node

antiPatterns.name: Confirmation Trap
antiPatterns.symptom: Searching for evidence that supports existing belief

antiPatterns.name: Authority Fallacy
antiPatterns.symptom: Accepting claims by source prestige rather than evidence

antiPatterns.name: Recency Trap
antiPatterns.symptom: Only recent sources, missing foundational work

antiPatterns.name: Infinite Rabbit Hole
antiPatterns.fix: Write decision/action anchor, return to it
